page.title: 13Railway Museum B'ham
page.content: The Birmingham Railway Museum is is Tyseley next to Tyseley BR Station and by the Warwick Road. It was set up in 1969 onn the site of the old Great Western Railway Engine shed. The shed had been used by GWR since 1908 to service locomotives and rolling stock on lines to London, Wales and Cornwall as well as within the Midlands. The museum is today one of the most important in Britain restoring and maintaining steam trains for exhibition to the public. The museum such famous working locomotives as Clun Castle and Kolhapur. It is open daily and there is a souvenir shop and restaurant. Each month there are steam days on the first Sunday from April to December. In the summer months the museum is a major tourist attraction.
